title: Krishna is beyond material reality! | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Krishna is promising that simply by understanding that Lord is not material, yet how he is in the material world.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that Krishna is beyond material energy and understanding His divine birth and activities leads to liberation from the cycle of birth and death.
segments.transcript: So this has to be very, very clear to us that Krishna is not of this material energy. Even though He is coming on my tongue, He is not of the material energy. 5000 years back also when Krishna came here, He is not of this material energy. Just because my material eyes could see Him, He is not material. That is the reason in Bhagavad Gita Krishna says, simply by knowing what is the nature of Krishna's janma karma as divine, anybody who knows, means in truth, one understands this, he has no more birth in this material world. So, what we are discussing today, what we are discussing yesterday, exactly same thing. We are trying to understand the janma karma, appearance of the nama on my tongue, and what are the activities of the nama avatara. Once you understand this, there is no more birth and death, old age, disease. Krishna is promising that simply by understanding that Lord is not material, yet how He is in the material world. This is the understanding of the tattva of avatara or incarnation.

segments.key_quote: Even before entering the field of nama bhajana, one should first know for certain that Krishna's form, Krishna's name, Krishna's service, Krishna's servants are all eternally free.
segments.summary: This segment quotes Bhaktivinoda Thakur, stressing the importance of understanding the transcendental nature of Krishna's form, name, and paraphernalia before engaging in nama bhajana (chanting).
segments.transcript: See, in Chaitanya Siksha Amrita, Bhaktivinoda Thakur says, "Even before entering the field of nama bhajana," that is, nama bhajana is what we are doing, japa, "one should first know for certain that Krishna's form, Krishna's name, Krishna's service, Krishna's servants are all eternally free." That is, they are beyond the grasp of maya, the illusory energy. Krishna, His transcendental abode and His paraphernalia are totally beyond material imagination. Similarly, His throne, His rooms, His gardens, forests, Govardhan Hill and river Yamuna. In fact, everything about Krishna cannot be touched by maya. It is especially important to remember the transcendental nature of the Lord Krishna when we approach His service, of which chanting His holy name is foremost. This understanding is not based on blind belief but on absolute eternal truth. So, Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: If we chant it properly without any offense, then we are directly in connection with Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment highlights Prabhupada's teachings on the power of chanting the holy name of Krishna without offense, leading to direct connection with Krishna and awakening of spiritual consciousness.
segments.transcript: Then Prabhupada in a lecture in Vrindavan, he says the holy name, chanting of the holy name, if we chant it properly without any offense, then we are directly in connection with Krishna. So, when the Lord is transcendental, then He is on my tongue on the vibrated sound and without offense if I chant, then I am directly in connection with Krishna. Next. One who hears Hare Krishna mantra, thus vibrated, is awakened to spiritual consciousness or Krishna consciousness. In this way, one's mind gradually becomes purified as stated by Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.

segments.key_quote: When mind is purified, the senses are also purified.
segments.summary: This segment explains that purification of the mind through chanting leads to purified senses, enabling engagement in transcendental service, and emphasizes that Krishna and Chaitanya Mahaprabhu appeared in Shuddha Sattva bodies.
segments.transcript: When mind is purified, the senses are also purified. Just see. Instead of using the senses for sense gratification, the awakened devotee employs the senses in the transcendental service of the Lord. This is a process by which dormant love of Krishna, Supreme Personality of Godhead, dormant love for Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead appears in order to teach us Vedic principles intended to understanding Him. Vedeshya Sarvair Aham Ev Vedyah. We should always know that when Krishna and Lord Chaitanya appeared, they appeared in Shuddha Sattva bodies. Please note that. We should always know that when Krishna and Lord Chaitanya appeared, they appeared in Shuddha Sattva bodies. One should not mistake the body of Krishna or Chaitanya Mahaprabhu to be a material body like ours. For Krishna and Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu appeared as needed for the benefit of the entire human society. Out of costless mercy, the Lord appears in different ages in His original Shuddha Sattva transcendental body to elevate human society to the platform upon which...

segments.key_quote: Never think of the deity as made of stone or wood. Every worshipper must remember that Krishna is personally present.
segments.summary: This segment presents a conversation with Srila Prabhupada, explaining that matter is Krishna's energy and can be transformed into spirit, emphasizing the importance of seeing Krishna's personal presence in the deity form.
segments.transcript: Conversation with Srila Prabhupada, ultimately everything is spiritual because matter is Krishna's energy. If Krishna is the original cause, therefore the matter can be changed into spirit and spirit can be changed to matter. Just as in the same electrical energy, acting as heater and cooler because the original cause is electricity. Similarly, the original cause is Krishna, so Krishna can change matter into spirit and spirit into matter. This is His power. The rascals and fools, when Krishna appears in His own body, Atma Maya, they think it is just like a material body. But they do not know that to Krishna, there is no distinction of material and spiritual. Never think of the deity as made of stone or wood. Every worshipper must remember that Krishna is personally present. He is simply kindly presenting Himself before us in a way so that we can handle Him. That is His mercy. Otherwise, He is unapproachable. There is no difference between matter and spirit for the Lord, although there is a gulf of difference between the two in the case of conditioned living beings. For the Lord, there is nothing but spiritual existence. Similarly, there is nothing except spiritual existence for the pure devotee of the Lord.
